description: Table T(a,b) by antidiagonals of winning positions in 3-pile Wythoff game (a square array).
comments: (a,b,T(a,b)) are the winning positions in 3-pile Wythoff game. A move in k-pile Wythoff is: pick a subset of the k piles and remove the same number of stones from each. Goal: take the last stone.T(a,b) = T(b,a). If T(a,b)=c then T(a,c)=b and T(b,c)=a.
mathematica: mex[ s_ ] := Min[ Complement[ Range[ 0, Max[ {s, -1} ]+1 ], Flatten[ s ] ] ]; f[ s_ ] := Join[ s, s+Table[ i, {i, Length[ s ]} ] ]; T[ a_, b_ ] := T[ a, b ] = mex[ { f[ Table[ T[ a-i, b ], {i, a} ] ], f[ Table[ T[ a, b-i ], {i, b} ] ], f[ Table[ T[ a-i, b-i ], {i, Min[ a, b ]} ] ] } ]
author: _Michael Kleber_
extensions: Edited and extended by _Christian G. Bower_, Oct 29 2002
